name: The Betsy Hotel, South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Miami (and Miami Beach) and I'm really happy that we chose the Betsy to stay in, since we were far from bowled over by Miami Beach itself. The Betsy is very cool - literally and metaphorically - and we loved getting back there to the lobby area and to our room (326, Ocean View) to get away from the heat outside.
reviews.title: The best thing about Miami Beach

reviews.text: The rooms and beds are very comfortable, though the bathroom was kind of small, and I was happy that we heard no noise at all from the road outside on any of our three nights there. The staff there are really top quality, at every level from doorman to waitress to concierge to customer service manager, we were attended to really well. We had 2 or 3 issues while we were there but they were all dealt with promptly and courteously, so no complaints at all.
reviews.title: All smiles

reviews.text: The hotel looks great and feels great. Sitting at the bar early evening having a drink was a pleasure, as was eating at BLT (pricey but worth it).
reviews.title: Service makes the Betsy stand out

reviews.text: Don't see myself going back to Miami or Miami Beach in a hurry, but if I do, I'll try to stay here again. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wow - this hotel deserves to be #1!!!

reviews.text: Just returned from the Betsy after a three night stay. Chose the property after research on Trip advisor, curious about the number one rating on Trip Advisor. The hotel staff are amazing at every level. First impression to last, just at every level outstanding civilized service. The staff smiles and pays attention to you at every level. Absolutely every staff member from valet, to concierge, to hostess, maid, and servers were absolutely outstanding. I can't give their customer service higher praise. They seem to go about their jobs in an effortless fashion and that makes you feel comfortable and tended to.
reviews.title: Oasis of Gentility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute you arrive, you are greeted by very friendly and helpful doormen as you enter a lovely, tastefully decorated lobby. The decor is beautiful, not opulent but refined and very tasteful and very south Florida! Located on the quiet end of Ocean Drive, yet easy walking distance to shopping and dining. Our room was fantastic! The third floor, on the corner, overlooking the ocean. I will definitely return!
reviews.title: Classic and Refined!

reviews.text: I stayed twice at the Betsy with my family (2 kids 5 and 8). The location is great right in front of the beach. There is a big difference in the rooms, the first time we had an ocean view room with a sitting room that had a convertible bed, great for the kids. The second time the room was in the back with the windows on an alley. Service is good, the lobby is very nice, the swimming pool rather cramped. The restaurant has excellent steak.
reviews.title: Very pleasant art deco Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I find the "resort fee" which gives you wi-fi access and access to beach facilities rather annoying.
reviews.title: A Milestone Birthday at the Betsy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Per i lettori italiani, ricordate i costi nascosti tipici degli alberghi USA : tasse di vario tipo, "resort dee" ecc. Comunque bellissimo albergo art deco.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel for Miami Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a previous stay turned out to be the "best night of our cruise", no wonder we chose to return for a milestone birthday. The beautiful rooms and public spaces, the great staff, the food and ambiance of BLT Steak, were all as remembered (think of unbelievable popovers!)
reviews.title: My annual South Beach vacation

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights staff couldn't do enough for you. Lovely hotel rooms are gorgeous, lovely staff, great location, gorgeous hotel would defiantly recommend. We liked it as away from the noise only thing was there's wasn't much choice on the breakfast menu apart from that fantastic!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: What a beautiful, totally charming hotel! Had never been to South Beach before so it was so lucky that we choose this hotel. It is right on Ocean Drive but at the end of it so we were actually able to get some sleep. It's right across from the beach with chairs and umbrellas included.The rooftop deck and wellness spa are amazing. The view from the rooftop is trully beautiful and the massages outside included being able to listen to of the birds. The hotel is within walking distant to Lincoln Mall and Espanola Way.
reviews.title: Charming place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I sincerely had the best steak dinner I have ever eaten at their "BLT" resturant! Amazing food exceptionaly prepared.
reviews.title: Quiet spot on South Beach

reviews.text: This hotel is not like the others on South Beach. It is small and quiet. The location is great - close to shopping and restaurants. Unless you really need a car, don't get one.Its not worth the trouble as there are plenty of cabs, and parking is expensive all over Miami & the hotel. The rooms are small but you probably won't spend much time there. The pool is also tiny but this is not the kind of hotel that has a pool scene. The hotel restaurant is excellent and has a nice area to eat outside along Ocean Ave.
reviews.title: A Calm Oasis in Miami

reviews.text: After nearly a month in Central America, I booked The Betsy for a nice treat at the end of our honeymoon. The staff were fairly friendly (having found me the best rate when I booked - a nice gesture I thought) and the room quite peaceful and quiet in the heat and buzz of Miami. In fact the room was so pleasant, we spent the whole evening holed up in our room in the lovely white towelling robes watching old films.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, luxe rooms and the best staff you'll ever have!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel in a prime Southbeach location with amazing, genuine and friendly staff - from the minute we arrived we felt really cared for and valued. We stayed for two nights to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday, I emailed the concierge a few days beforehand and was ecstatic when we arrived to find we'd been upgraded from a classic room to a classic suite and had a bottle of bubbly waiting in the room for us!
reviews.title: Lovely place, amazing staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor and feel of the hotel is lovely,having never been to Miami before the hotel looked exactly how I imagined it should! The suite we stayed in was fantastic - huge, comfortable, bright and airy, very comfy bed and good quality bedding. I loved the little extras provided - the TV in the bathroom mirror, coffee machine, white noise sleep machine and daily turndown service. The only reason I haven't given the hotel 5/5 is we didn't sleep very well at all. Even with the great bed and sleep machine our room was on the 1st floor facing an alley so we were disturbed by noise from passers by, garbage trucks and a lot of noise from the guests staying above us. I know this isn't the hotel's fault so it wouldn't put me off in the future but I'd request a room on a higher floor or go for a room overlooking the pool.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in South Beach

reviews.text: We ate brunch in the BLT restaurant and it was good, no complaints at all and the food quite reasonably priced for such a great hotel in a prime location.
reviews.title: Inviting!

reviews.text: The main thing that makes the hotel so great is the staff, I've never experienced such a fantastic level of service. Every single person we came across was lovely - so friendly and helpful, I felt like they really cared about us and that we were enjoying our stay. I wish I could remember everyone's name, you were all great. A big thank you to Nicky at the front desk, Margot the concierge, the valets, everyone who helped us with our bags and getting cabs! If you want to stay in a gorgeous hotel where you are made to feel really special then this is it!
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.text: It looks great from the outside and it certainly is great on the inside. The reception from all staff was excellent. The room was spotless and beautifully appointed. Bed was very comfortable and the shower (no bath) was refreshing. The bars (roof and lobby) are nice places to have a drink - and our meal at BLT (whilst quite pricey) was excellent. I really couldn't fault our stay - it was one of the best 2 or 3 hotels I have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, friendly Staff!

reviews.text: A fabulous small hotel with lovely rooms in a perfect location central to South Beach. There is a short walk to the beautiful beach across the street. The hotel restaurant BLT was so great we ate there most of the time, always outside on front porch (even in the rain) or on the rooftop overlooking the ocean. Both the hotel and restaurant had very friendly and professional staff. All the concierges were extra helpful. We are ready to go back anytime.
reviews.title: The Betsy Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in this beautiful boutique hotel for 3 nights and I wish we had more time! The hotel is a colonial style building right in front of the beach and close to just anything! All the best places to shop and eat are around the corner.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Miami Beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite and we really enjoyed this experience. The stuff was super friendly and helpful besides some people at the restaurant during our breakfast that were rather uninterested. That was maybe the only drawback that we found.
reviews.title: Not your average review

reviews.text: I definitely advise this AMAZING hotel experience to anyone wishing to stay in Miami Beach and if we are back again one day I will look no further than the BETSY!
reviews.title: Overall Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you again for this enjoyable stay!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.text: I was really looking forward to my stay at The Betsy - having visited the hotel briefly a couple of months ago. There are certainly some positives. The hotel has been beautifully renovated in a Ralph Lauren/Colonial design. Rooms, although small (it is an old hotel) are beautiful and have everything you need for a comfortable stay. I had a room at the front, which meant I had a nice view of Ocean Drive and the palm trees, but you do get the street noise, which can go on late into the night. The hotel's location on Ocean Drive, does mean that you are in the heart of the South Beach scene, but has become a bit tacky and full of a noisy, unrefined crowd. The Betsy has a beautiful rooftop terrace, which is great to get away from the crowds for a peaceful drink, early morning yoga, or a relaxing spa treatment (I had a lovely massage). There is a pool, in the courtyard - not very big and enclosed. So not the best in the area and with little atmosphere. The Fitness Room is small, but offers a nice range of equipment. The Front Desk/Concierge Staff are very friendly and helpful, as are Housekeeping and the Roof/Spa. However this is where the problems start. The Betsy is a hotel that has chosen to outsource a lot of its services. The Spa, Restaurant and Bar. The latter two to the famous New York BLT Restaurant. The first problem lies with breakfast - which is something a restaurant famed for its steaks probably does not want to do, but is necessary in a hotel. The offering is poor and the staff unfriendly and equally unhelpful. This attitude also extends into lunch and dinner service. Where the food is good, but it's let down some of the worst service I have experienced in years. This is nothing compared to the Bar ... The hotel has a lovely Lobby Lounge/Bar. Guest sitting in the Lounge are ignored and have to get up and go to the bar to order and pick up their drinks. Even if you sit at the Bar, the service is minimal and you have to practically grab the Bar Tenders to get their attention. After numerous nights of experiencing this, I then received the ultimate in arrogant, bad service (I travel the world and can say this is the worst thing I have ever encountered). My bill was presented, with the following hand written at the bottom SERVICE IS NOT INCLUDED, with the word NOT double underlined and the suggested service amounts double ringed. When I asked the Barman to explain his actions, I got little more than an arrogant, uninterested response. I clearly explained that I had been in the hotel all week, had always tipped well and found this action most insulting. I suppose you could see that many others agreed - both the bar and restaurant were never that busy. However The Betsy guests do not always understand about other company's running different parts of the hotel and the Management will be judged as a whole. BLT severely let down this hotel and as the restaurant and bar are key, they really need to address the problem.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: We (the family) stayed at the Betsy for 4 nights and then after a couple of days in Key West we went back home. Home is just the exact word for how you feel when coming to the Betsy. The warmth, the friendly atmosphere, the people. In The Betsy you will find everything that you search for. I travel at least 3-4 nights per week all over Europe and I have never experienced anything like The Betsy and I will probably never experience it unless I return. There must be something "magic" behind like very good owners, management etc that can attract the right people and set standards that is not only built upon standards but that employees like to work at The Betsy. I can only give our strongest recommendations, BOOK THIS HOTEL!!
reviews.title: The BEST Hotel we ever stayed in!!

reviews.text: Recently spent 3 days at Betsy's,with a couple of friends as part a our US holiday. What a superb hotel full of great staff, loved the atmosphere, the food and the location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We are already looking forward to the next time.
reviews.title: A gorgeous stay in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stuart & Sheila Littlewood Manchester UK
reviews.title: THe best hotel on Ocean Drive
A "terribly" good experience
reviews.text: The other day I stopped over at the Betsy with my family after an extended USA trip down from N.Y. to Miami. Having said that, I have seen quite a few hotels along the East Cost (but also across the nation as we travel the US frequently). Given the location and the reputation of the Betsy, expectations were pretty elevated. Now, those expectations deflated rather rapidly after checking in and moving to our deluxe room of 250 sqm and sea view. Forget about the sea view, which is absolutely irrelevant. Given the size of the room (it equals 22 sqm for Europeans who are unfamiliar with US measures) you don't want to stay in this prison cell for too long and stare through the half open blinds at the distant ocean.

reviews.title: Elegant and stylish hotel
reviews.text: It really gets worse, when you try to stuff your familiy (wife plus 2 small kids) into the room along with 5 bags and hope for a good nights sleep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never mind, here comes the "terrible" part of the story. After requesting late night at the front desk to check out the next day no matter what, the helpful front officer was quick to avoid complete disaster and offered an alternative solution for the remaining night in the form of a suite (with view to the backyard). I could even have a look at the room after midnight, mind you.
reviews.title: So friendly

reviews.text: To make a long story short, the always friendly and helpful staff did their upmost to correct my fault (in not checking properly out, what kind of rooms we are looking at) and make our short stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel manager even offered a bottle of wine and miraculously, the larger room with backyard view through the blinds was even less expensive!
reviews.title: Highlight of our stay in Miami!!

reviews.text: Otherwise, the hotel has all the charme you would expect. It looks terrific by day and night and the restaurant is fabulous. Service and friendliness are worth 10 points if there were 10 to give. As a guest, I find the hotel is far too expensive for the available infrastructure.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: on holiday with my wife from the uk, had the hotel recommended by the guys at destinology, and yet again they came up trumps. At the quiet end of ocean drive. got in late and had room service from the main restaurant BLT which was excellent.
reviews.title: stylish and seamless

reviews.text: The rooftop bar is great, although we didnt spend much time here. The staff are amazing and everything runs seamlessly. It is less brash and obvious that the W and such like. The concierge Paul ( the best of the three) was great. He recommended great restaurants and arranged a fishing trip for us. More importantly steered us away from where not to go.
reviews.title: Gorgeous and Elegant

reviews.text: The beach is a stones throw and the beach club is easy to use.
reviews.title: Lovely labor day weekend

reviews.text: we will hopefully return..
reviews.title: Everyone should stay on South Beach at least once
THE Best hotel in Miami!
reviews.text: thanks to everyone at the hotel

description: An iconic landmark hotel on Miami's Ocean Drive, The Betsy Hotel is a stunning colonial masterpiece offering a serene escape with exceptional cuisine, a rooftop solarium and spa with sweeping sea views. This beachfront property enables guests to enjoy the white sand and turquoise waters where Beach Butlers will attend to their every need. The hotel also created a peaceful sanctuary in its secluded courtyard where guests can enjoy the tranquil pool or relax in the lounge chairs. Home of BLT Steak, Laurent Tourendel's famous French spin on the traditional American Steakhouse.
